main event: A ground radar operator detected an unidentified object near Gravel, Ohio on June 27, 1962.
interesting points: The object was first detected on radar at 22:00 at an altitude of 3,000-4,000 feet.
Visual contact was made with the object at 22:12, which showed rapid diminishing and intermittent illumination.
The object was estimated to be 25-30 feet in diameter and moved in a straight line course, appearing to accelerate and diminish in size.
The object was lost to sight on radar at 23:00.
The radar operator's report was considered credible, but the sighting was casually dismissed as a meteor.
photographs: yes, according to the record card
